subject: Biology
question_text: A plant species lives in ponds. The diagrams show the whole plant and a section through one of its leaves.

difficulty.justification: Tests understanding of plant adaptations to aquatic environments and basic ecological concepts.

sub_questions.text:
The leaves are adapted to float on the surface of the water.
Suggest one advantage to the plant of the leaves floating on the surface of water.
Name the parts of the leaf labelled A and B.
With reference to parts A and B, describe and explain how the structure of the leaf is adapted to a pond environment.

The plant is part of a food web in a pond.
State its trophic level.
